intro: Oxydectes micans, commonly known as the silverleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and showy yellow-centered flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its small, daisy-like flowers bloom in spring and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Oxydectes micans is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
